manualGet.institution: Department of Parasitology, Institute of Medical Science, University of Tokyo

resource.pluginArgs: --sourceIdRegex "\|(\w+\(\S+\))$" --fastaFile @dataDir@/reffull_pv.fas --externalDatabaseName %EXT_DB_NAME% --externalDatabaseVer %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% --SOTermName 'transcript' --ncbiTaxId 5855 --libraryVector 'pME18SFL3' --contactName 'Junichi Watanabe' --contactAddress1 "Institute of Medical Science; The University of Tokyo, Department of Parasitology" --contactAddress2 "4-6-1, Shirokanedai, Minatoku, Tokyo 108-8639, Japan" --putativeFullLength --libraryName 'derivedFromWatanabePv' --libraryDesc "Predicted full length transcript sequence produced after BLAT alignment of the WatanabePv EST library sequences to the genome and correction of the cDNA sequences using annotated gene sequences."
resource.description: P. vivax redicted full length transcript sequences.

resource.displayName: J.Watanabe, H.Wakaguri1, M.Sasaki1, Y.Suzuki1, S.Sugano1 P. vivax EST library

manualGet.institution: Department of Parasitology, Institute of Medical Science, University of Tokyo

resource.pluginArgs: --sourceIdRegex "\|(\w+)$" --fastaFile @dataDir@/onepass_pv.fas --externalDatabaseName %EXT_DB_NAME% --externalDatabaseVer %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% --SOTermName 'EST' --ncbiTaxId 5855 --libraryVector 'pME18SFL3' --contactName 'Junichi Watanabe' --contactAddress1 "Institute of Medical Science; The University of Tokyo, Department of Parasitology" --contactAddress2 "4-6-1, Shirokanedai, Minatoku, Tokyo 108-8639, Japan" --libraryName 'WatanabePv' --libraryDesc "Blood samples were collected from the Indonesian patients with P. vivax who were diagnosed by Giemsa staining of the blood smear and gave the written informed consent. Heparinized whole blood was filtrated through Plasmodipur filter (Eurodiagnostica) to remove white blood cells. Parasites were homogenized using the Polytron Homogenizer, frozen in liquid nitrogen and sent to Japan with dry ice."

resource.pluginArgs: --extDbRelSpecList "P.vivax contigs from Genbank|@pvContigVer@,P. vivax mitochondrial genome|@pvMitoVer@"

resource.description: Phenotype links from Genetically Modified Rodent Malaria Parasites: Pberghei.eu hosts a database containing information on genetically modified rodent malaria parasite lines generated by many labs worldwide. Specifically, it contains data of three rodent malaria parasite species; Plasmodium berghei, P. yoelii and P. chabaudi. The aim of this database is to provide the research community access to detailed information on the generation (e.g. disruption, tagging, mutation, transgene expression) and phenotype of genetically modified malaria parasites. The database not only provides information on 'successful' mutants with a clear phenotype, but also (un)published mutants without a clear phenotype and (un)published negative trials to disrupt genes.

resource.displayName: P. vivax Genbank contigs sequences DBRefs
Transcriptional profile throughout 48-h intraerythrocytic cycle of three distinct P. vivax isolates

manualGet.institution: School of Biological Sciences, Nanyang Technological University

resource.description: Transcriptional profile throughout the 48-h intraerythrocytic cycle of three distinct P. vivax isolates.

Sporozoites were purified from dissected mosquitoes fed on monkeys infected with the genome reference strain Salvador I at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Atlanta, Georgia. Asexual blood stage parasites were obtained from P. vivax-infected patients in Iquitos, Peru. White blood cells were removed by CF-11 cellulose column filtration, asexual parasites were enriched by gradient centrifugation and purified by saponin lysis of RBCs. Total RNA was isolated from purified parasites and subjected to two rounds of RNA amplification for microarray analysis as described previously (Zhou, et al. 2008). Experimental technical replicate hybridizations were performed for the single sporozoite sample and two asexual samples (CM012 and CM013). Gene expression values were calculated using MOID; expression profiles were clustered using OPI as described previously (Zhou, et al. 2008).

Scott J Westenberger, Colleen M McClean, Rana Chattopadhyay, Neekesh V Dharia, Jane M Carlton, John W Barnwell, William E Collins, Stephen L Hoffman, Yingyao Zhou, Joseph M Vinetz, Elizabeth A Winzeler. Plasmodium vivax transcriptome analysis reveals divergent in vivo blood stage profiles and species-specific sporozoite gene expression. (in submission)

resource.displayName: P.vivax proteomics data from clinical samples (Tatu)
resource.description: Data produced by proteomics analysis of clinical isolates of early stages of P. vivax. Patient derived malarial parasites were directly processed and analyzed using shotgun proteomics approach using high sensitivity mass spectrometry for protein identification. Utpal Tatu, Department of Biochemistry, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, 560012, karnataka, India.
